message: The new release has a load of new features/improvements and a new frontend site as well. If anyone has any feedback we'd really appreciate it: http://interstateapp.com
And if you'd like an invite please just request one and post your email/URL here and we'll get one sent out.
@simonify I am a giant tool -- I already had a beta.  :'(
it's super cool
how did you guys do the ui - just html(5) etc?
and obviously HTML :P
barry.melton@gmail.com -- I'd love to test drive it for StartupWeekend, see how that goes.  I think I've said before (elsewhere), but it's a gorgeous app.
@simonify what's the backend done with?
We've just launched a new version/release of our startup; Interstate :)
(also really like the app)
I know that, but the way it is phrased it sends out a negative message. It's one of those NLP things
Could you request one via http://interstateapp.com/invite/request using that email and I'll send it out straight away
@simonify Done, sorry, and thanks!
Thanks! Sent the invite.
Looks cool - looking fwd to playing with it :)
and MongoDB for the data store
neat
the invites a bit easier to send when it's in the database, lol. Thanks btw! :)
@imajes we'll take a look to see if there's anything we can do to make it a bit better for when you first join
but we'll definitely look in to making it more simple and clearer.
but yeah, we'll definitely spend some time to look in to it
When we leave BETA the join process is going to be a lot clearer and explain what exactly a BakedCode ID is
We're hoping to have a few more apps in the future so we had to implement a global ID to begin with
to make things easier in the future
we've tried to follow 37signal's model of having a global account ID
which is why the ID is being explained currently
@imajes hey, which bit exactly?
@imajes sent you an invite :)
Aha, no worries :-) Hope you like the new version a little better.
Yeah, MongoDB has been awesome so far.
@simonify: also, i'd suggest looking at making the concept of a baked code id clearer

And another little detail: I think the tooltip with the permission granted over the photographer sends the wrong message, or at least the wording is less than optimal. If you need a tooltip there then perhaps some nice words about the author. Everyone assumes that this photo is used with permission.
Just CSS and a bit of JS
simonify: jquery-ui etc? it's pretty neat, i'd love to, er, steal your approach ;)
love the transparent header on top when logged in, nicely done.
PHP
We use jQuery UI for the calendar but that's it
we only switched to jQuery from Prototype in this release
nice, thx. MongoDB is great
and thanks btw :)
@simonify: the big name bar at the top with the name of the interstate seems a little wasted?
The header of the app-side is as tall as it is as you can put a logo there, etc.
yeah, it just looked a little empty in default mode
it seems a bit weird.
agree, the whole baked code id is a distraction
cool
Companies using our app would be a much better, positive message
just requested an invite - this looks gorgeous
Looking forward to giving it a shot!
Same goes for "We only show companies who have agreed to appear here!". That makes me think :P
Hmm, we'll have a think and ask some more of our visitors what they think and if they'd prefer it switched to something like that that instead. Thanks again for the feedback!
ok, well, just don't tell people about that

We tried to do something like that by having "Interstate provides businesses and developers alike with a solution for keeping on top of development tasks using awesome roadmaps! Learn more by taking the tour." but I can see how that may not really explain what the app helps you do
@martin_sunset thanks! :)
@kenschultz invite sent! :)
but don't actually use it

We're telling people now, so when they end up seeing "BakedCode" everywhere they know it's us from day one. Otherwise it will be even more confusing down the line when BakedCode starts emailing you about account changes.
but meh
and just convert when it makes sense

Something else I noticed. The home page does not explain why interstate is good for me. When I first saw the site a couple of months ago I really wondered what it is good for. I think you need a one liner, very prominently saying something like InterstateApp helps you keep track of your ....
We're trying to give credit to everyone who's helped us build the site and having a link to the photographer was part of the agreement to let us use their photo
thanks for the invite!
@simonify better go with standard login + twitter, fb and expose each of your apps as an oauth endpoint, but keep it seperate on the outside
and by convert i mean, "convert"
We know that a lot of apps just list companies who have signed up for their service
So we've tried to make it clear that these companies really do use our product and have asked/are happy to be shown on the homepage.
you are welcome. I really like what you are doing and the effort you put into this
@martin_sunset: yep - that sounds
sounds right (the nlp)
@simonify: please please link it to pivotal tracker.
i also love that you have your own roadmap up
lol, integration with other services is something which we're hoping to look in to in a few months time
mn
man, i'd pay today if it integrated into tracker (validation)
sweet, well we don't use Pivotal Tracker ourselves so we're hoping to meet up with someone who does who can help us decide the best way to integrate with it
Just saw your request - invite sent :P & thanks!
Yeah, we had that feature but when we launched one of our newer BETAs we forgot to include it
I'll probably add it back in later today
btw, it would be nice if the invite code was auto-filled when you click the link to the join page
that too
@simonify; well, i do

btw if you guys use the main Hacker News site any comments/upvotes on the main thread would be appreciated: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2419932 so we can also get some thoughts from those who don't use Convore
thanks! :)
upvoted.
Thanks! I've just sent all the newest invite requests a code so you should have received one.
just requested an invite. looks very nice, congrats
sure did, thanks
awesome :) please do share any feedback whether it's positive or negative :P
Quite proud to say that we've been invited for a Y Combinator interview :)
@simonify Awesome. Congrats & best of luck.
great looking app! good luck! sign me up for a demo: vshlos@oimae.com
just requested an invite, from the tour it looks really great! Can't wait to testdrive it.
thanks guys, i'll get your invites sent out asap!
Requested an invite, would love to give it a spin.
Sent you guys all an invite :-)
Just requested an invite. Looks lovely and just what I was looking for.
I just requested one as well, I've been looking for something like this.
@awfy i see. but from the outside looking in, the main feature is kinda overlap.... interstate top-down, uservoice bottom-up, right?
@unwrangle we're not aiming to replace any services with Interstate, if anything we want to enable people to use Interstate along side a lot of the current services.
@simonify is it just a top-down uservoice / getsatisfaction? why would i use interstate instead / on top of uservoice?
@undefined well our main reason for existence is to build roadmaps/status boards similar to that of CulturedCode's. I see UserVoice's as community generated feedback.
Nice idea, invite requested :-)
@awfy got it and thanks!
Looks great, looking forward to trying it!
nice
Thanks @benjamin1226
Oh, interesting. Would love to check it out! Can I haz invite? :)
@levifig just checked, seems you already have an invite.
And this is where I go hide in shame… :x lol Thanks :D
Can I get an invite please?
looks good - just requested an invite - @rosshinkle.
I created an account and started testing it. It seems a nice idea.Can we propose features?
I would also like to suggest to make a better tour (maybe a youtube video) because it was not clear (for me) what interstateapp is good for.
polska
@newlynx that will be coming when we publicly launch.
@newlynx and feel free to suggest ideas via our Get Satisfaction or just on here.
biało czerwnoi

@simonify: Is interstate app backed/run by the same people as virb?  If so, I'm interested in hearing how those individuals' experiences with virb (once slated to be the myspace killer, soon off the radar totally) have informed their process with interstate app;  I imagine they learned a LOT.  So, move more slowly, target more, give away less... what lessons from virb are being applied here?  If I'm totally off the mark about virb just ignore my question. :) also I'm @_sequoia; would you please approve my invite request?  Thank you!  Application looks cool.
@sequoia Nah, Interstate is ran by myself and @awfy. VIRB do use the service though :)
oh.  darn! thank you!
